body.p: To his excellency Gov. Beriah Mcgoffin

Your petitioner John Combs states that at the present term of the Perry Circuit Court he was fined in this sum of Seventy five Dollars on a charge of having cut Samuel Combs with a Knife he states that he is a small weekly man and that Samuel Combs is a large stout man and the petitioner only inflicted an insignificant cut upon him producing no injury that the petitioner & Samuel Combs were boath very Much under the influence of Whiskey not at all at themselves, Your petitioner is a very poor man with Young wife & two small Children and it requires every thing he can earn to support his family --
Your petitioner prays your excellency in consideration of the premises to interpose your pardoning power & remit sd fine.
We the undersigned pray your excellency to remit said fine believing as we do that the statements of the above petitioners are true

Names
E. F. Hogg.
Jesse Combs Jr
H. C. Heogg
Jon. D,, Cooley
John Fellman
S. T. Hogg Exam P C
Shadwick Duff
John Baker
Elijah Combs

Perry C. H. Ky. May 15th 1861
Dear Gov.
I hope your excellency will interpose your pardning power & remit the fine refered to in the petion John Combs is certainly not able to pay the fine

Yours truly
David G. Lyttle
Granville Pearl
Jas B. Fitzpatrick
Andrew Combs
Harra Sisemore
P. W. Hall
Henderson Baker
Mahlon Fields
William W. Combs
